intro: Centaurea massoniana, commonly known as the Masson's bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring blue to purple ray florets and yellow disk florets. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Centaurea massoniana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats.
